clinical_study.brief_title: Bedside Ultrasound of Gastric Contents in Pediatric Populations
clinical_study.official_title: Bedside Ultrasound Assessment of Gastric Contents in Interventional Radiology (IR) for Pediatric Populations

brief_summary.textblock: Perioperative aspiration of gastric contents is a rare but serious adverse event. The risk of aspiration can be estimated by perioperative evaluation of stomach contents with ultrasound using a validated technique and scoring system. A lack of knowledge or familiarity is frequently cited by anesthesia providers as a rationale for not performing perioperative ultrasound assessments. The purpose of this study is to determine whether novice ultrasonography users (medical students or undergraduates) can be effectively taught a technique to evaluate stomach contents as compared to experts in ultrasonography.

primary_outcome.measure: Novice vs Expert Ultrasonographers Gastric Evaluation
primary_outcome.time_frame: After the induction of the anesthesia and before the procedure start, typically less than one hour
primary_outcome.description: The gastric evaluation of novice and expert ultrasonographers will be compared based on a 3-point numerical evaluation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time elapsed to reach gastric evaluation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the induction of the anesthesia and before the procedure start, typically less than one hour
secondary_outcome.description: Time elapsed to reached gastric evaluation will be assessed in both novice and expert ultrasonographers

arm_group.description: Novice ultrasonographers will be taught to assess gastric contents with a short and simple educational program. These results will be compared to the evaluation of experts in ultrasonography i.e interventional radiologists.
Physician assessment i.e interventional radiologist evaluation of gastric contents using ultrasonography.

intervention.description: Ultrasonography use for the evaluation of gastric contents

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients must:
1. be between ages of 2-17 years of age
2. have parental consent
3. undergoing interventional radiology procedures under general anesthesia at Lucile Packard Children's Hospital (LPCH)
Exclusion Criteria:
General Exclusion Criteria are as follows:
1. Undergoing emergent surgical procedures
2. Patients who do not consent to be in the sudy
